column1: Linhai (simplified Chinese: 临海; traditional Chinese: 臨海; pinyin: Línhǎi; Tai-chow dialect: Lin-he) is a county-level city in Taizhou
column2: Zhejiang Province situated on the banks of the Lin River in Eastern China.

column4: 813 inhabitants even though its built-up (or metro) area is much smaller.

column1: Its Cathedral of the Sacred Heart of Jesus is the episcopal see of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Linhai.
Its wall attracts many tourists. According to the tickets for access to the wall
column4: began in the Jin Dynasty (265-420) and was not finished until the Sui (581-618) and Tang (618-907) Dynasties. The northern portion
column8: still exist and are in good condition.
